title: ‘Egregious’: Allston bar shut down over repeated underage drinking violations
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Local News A Boston police detective said upwards of 100 people hurried out from the Allston bar one night after realizing officers were checking IDs.
The Draft Bar and Grille in Allston has its liquor license suspended indefinitely on Jan.
8 after the Boston Licensing Board found repeated underage drinking violations.

title: Patriots stock watch: Here’s who stood out and struggled against the Chargers
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: New England Patriots It was a bit of a bizarre game for the Patriots on offense.
Milton Williams sacks Justin Herbert during the Patriots' playoff win.

Danielle Parhizkaran/Globe Staff FOXBOROUGH — The Sunday night battle between Drake Maye and Justin Herbert wound up being a low-scoring affair, and the momentum swung in the Patriots’ favor during the second half after a lackluster start.

title: Man facing assault charges after other man injured in fight during Bruins game at TD Garden
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Local News Aaron Tucker, 49, is charged with assault and battery resulting in serious bodily injury, and assault and battery against 60+/disabled.
A man was arrested Saturday after a fight during a Bruins game at TD Garden that led to another man being hospitalized with a head injury, police said.

The man arrested, identified by police as Aaron Tucker, 49, is set to be arraigned at Boston Municipal Court Monday on charges of assault and battery resulting in serious bodily injury, and assault and battery against a 60+ or disabled victim, according to a Boston police report.

title: State Police: Mass. after-school instructor died by suicide as police served search warrant for child pornography
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Crime “The State Police Detective Unit assigned to the Worcester County District Attorney’s Office was notified of the apparent suicide by firearm.
” A Princeton afterschool teacher died in an apparent suicide as police served a search warrant at his home to search for child porn, State Police said.

John Buffington, 67, was an after-school instructor for the Town of Princeton Parks and Recreation Department, where he taught “woodworking, primitive skills, and kite-making,” State Police said in a press release Friday.

title: 10 takeaways from Patriots’ playoff win over Chargers
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: New England Patriots New England’s defense stepped up on Sunday, sacking Justin Herbert six times and holding him to just 159 passing yards.
New England's defense delivered on Sunday night against the Chargers, sacking Justin Herbert six times.
(AP Photo/Robert F.

title: Weekend downtown protests encapsulate growing national outrage at recent ICE shootings
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Local News More anti-ICE protests were held Saturday in Boston after multiple recent ICE-involved shootings in Minnesota and Oregon.
Protesters gathered Saturday in downtown Boston to demonstrate against recent shootings involving federal immigration agents.

Finn Gomez/The Boston Globe By Darin Zullo January 11, 2026 | 11:14 AM 2 minutes to read Hundreds of anti-ICE demonstrators gathered downtown Saturday for Boston’s third protest since Renee Nicole Good was fatally shot Wednesday by a federal officer in Minneapolis.

title: 2025 marked decline in Mass. fire deaths following spike in 2024, officials say
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Local News The 12 percent drop in deaths came despite the Gabriel House fire, one of the deadliest in decades.
This graph depicts last year's overall decline in fire deaths statewide after a spike in 2024.

Department of Fire Services By Darin Zullo January 11, 2026 | 10:00 AM 2 minutes to read Fire deaths in Massachusetts dropped 12 percent in 2025 after a seven-year high in 2024, according to new data from fire officials.

title: Red Sox reportedly eyeing Bo Bichette after missing out on Alex Bregman
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Boston Red Sox Bichette is a top remaining free agent, and Boston is in need of a right-handed bat in its lineup.
Bo Bichette is one of the best free agents available now that Alex Bregman is off the table.
(AP Photo/Brynn Anderson) Now that Alex Bregman is a Chicago Cub, the Red Sox will have to look elsewhere to bolster their infield and add a right-handed bat to their lineup.
